title: Replace every element with greatest on right
description: Given an array of integers, replace every element with the next greatest element (greatest element on the right side) in the array. Since there is no element next to the last element, replace it with -1. For example, if the array is {16, 17, 4, 3, 5, 2}, then it should be modified to {17, 5, 5, 5, 2, -1}.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Boolean Matrix Modification
description: Given a Boolean matrix mat[M][N] of size M X N, modify it such that if a matrix cell mat[i][j] is 1 then make its adjacent cells as 0.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Equilibrium Index of Array
description: Equilibrium index of an array is an index such that the sum of elements at lower indexes is equal to the sum of elements at higher indexes. Example: Input: A[] = {-7, 1, 5, 2, -4, 3, 0}, Output: 3
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: MS-Paint Flood Fill Algorithm
description: In MS-Paint, when we take the brush to a pixel and click, the color of the region of that pixel is replaced with a new selected color. Given a 2D screen, location of a pixel in the screen and a color, replace color of the given pixel and all adjacent same colored pixels with the given color.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Print Matrix in Zig-Zag Fashion
description: Given a matrix of 2D array of n rows and m columns. Print this matrix in ZIG-ZAG fashion. Example: Input: 1 2 3, 4 5 6, 7 8 9, Output: 1 2 4 7 5 3 6 8 9
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Remove Duplicates with Character Replacement
description: Remove the duplicates in the String. If a character is duplicated, replace it with the next character. Example: Input: Java1234, Output: Javb1234 (Remove the second 'a' as it is duplicated). Input: Python1223, Output: Python1234
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Version Comparison
description: Print whether the version is upgraded, downgraded or not changed according to the input given. Example: Input: Version1 4.8.2 Version2 4.8.4 Output: upgraded
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Print All Subsets with Given Sum
description: Print all possible subsets of the given array whose sum equal to given N. Example: Input: {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} N=6 Output: {1, 2, 3}, {1, 5}, {2, 4}
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Reverse Words from First Occurrence
description: Reverse the words in the given String1 from the first occurrence of String2 in String1 by maintaining white Spaces. Example: String1 = 'This is a test String only' String2 = 'st' Output: 'This is a only String test'
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Maximum Chocolates Problem
description: Calculate Maximum number of chocolates can eat and Number of wrappers left in hand. Given Money, Price, wrappers, choco, Max visit. Example: Money:40 Price:1 wrappers:3 choco:1 Max visit:1 Output: total chocolate can eat: 53 wrappers left in hand:14
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Alternate Character Extraction
description: Given a string, extract alternate characters. Sample Input: 2, Hacker, Rank. Sample Output: Hce akr, Rn ak
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Print Word with Odd Letters
description: Print the word with odd letters in diamond pattern. Sample Input: PROGRAM. Sample Output: P pattern with spacing
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Alternate Sorting
description: Given an array, sort it in alternating order of largest and smallest. Input: {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7}, Output: {7, 1, 6, 2, 5, 3, 4}
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Bike Trip Problem
description: Given an array of values persons[], each represents the weight of the persons. There will be infinite bikes available. Given a value K which represents the maximum weight that a bike accommodates. Find out the least number of bike trips.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Grid Movement Tracking
description: Assume there exists infinite grid, you're given initial position x, y. Inputs will be movements either L or R or U or D. After n inputs, you need to give the current position. Input: 4 5 (initial), 9 movements: U L R R D D U L R, Output: 5 5
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Matrix Path Finding
description: Given a matrix NxN, you are initially in the 0,0 position. The matrix is filled with ones and zeros. Value '1' represents the path is available, while '0' represents the wall. Find if you can reach (N-1)x(N-1) index. You can move only along right and down directions.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Maximum Digit Value
description: Given an array of integers, compute the maximum value for each integer by either summing all digits or multiplying all digits. Input: 5, 120 24 71 10 59. Output: 3 8 8 1 45
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Number of Islands
description: -1 represents ocean and 1 represents land, find the number of islands in the given matrix. Input: n*n matrix with 1s and -1s. Output: Count of islands
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Print Subsets with Given Sum
description: Print all the possible subsets of array which adds up to give a sum. Input: array{2, 3, 5, 8, 10}, sum=10. Output: {2, 3, 5}, {2, 8}, {10}
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Circular Queue Safe Position (Josephus Problem)
description: There is a circular queue of processes. Every time there will be certain no of process skipped and a particular start position. Find the safe position. Input: Number of process:5, Start:3, Skip:2nd. Output: 1 will be the safest position
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Snake Pattern Without Array
description: Given N, print the snake pattern. Condition: must not use arrays (1D or 2D). Example: N=4 prints 1 2 3 4, 8 7 6 5, 9 10 11 12, 16 15 14 13
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Latin Matrix Without Strings
description: Given N, print the Latin Matrix. Condition: must not use strings, arrays, inbuilt functions. Example: N=3 prints A B C, B C A, C A B
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Minimum Count of 0-1 Numbers for Sum
description: Given a number N, find the minimum count of numbers in which N can be represented as a sum where each number's digits are only 0s and 1s. Example: N=33, Output: 3 (11+11+11)
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: String Permutations (Backtracking)
description: Finding all permutations of a string using backtracking approach.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Rearrange Array Alternating Max-Min
description: Given an array of integers, rearrange the array in the form: 1st_largest, 1st_smallest, 2nd_largest, 2nd_smallest, 3rd_largest, etc.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Sort by Number of Factors
description: Sort the given elements in descending order based on the number of factors of each element.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Palindrome Check Without Arrays
description: Find whether the given number is palindrome or not. Don't use arrays or strings.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Reverse String Keeping Special Characters
description: Reverse the given string keeping the position of special characters intact.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Shortest Path Using Right and Down
description: Find the shortest path from one element to another element in a matrix using right and down moves alone.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Pattern Printing
description: Print various patterns as specified in the problem.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Pangram Checking
description: Check whether all English alphabets are present in the given sentence or not. Input: 'abc defGhi JklmnOP QRStuv wxyz', Output: True
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Password Strength
description: Find the strength of the given password string based on conditions. Four rules based on type and number of characters. Output: Weak/Medium/Good/Strong
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: First Occurrences
description: Given two strings, find the first occurrence of all characters of second string in the first string and print characters between least and highest index. Input: ZOHOCORPORATION PORT, Output: OHOCORPORAT
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Matrix Diagonal Sum
description: Given a matrix, print the largest of the sums of the two triangles split by diagonal from top right to bottom left. Input: 3x3 matrix, Output: 38
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Matrix Addition
description: Given n integer arrays of different size, find the addition of numbers represented by the arrays. Input: arrays representing digits, Output: sum as number
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Remove Characters from String
description: Remove all duplicate characters. Input: aaabbcc, Output: abc
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Evaluate and Sort Expressions
description: Evaluate the expression and sort and print the output. Input: expressions like 2*3, 2^2^2, 35, 3*1. Output: sorted by evaluated value
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Build Two Towers with Blocks
description: Given 6 blocks of different heights, make 2 towers using 3 blocks each in desired heights. Input: 1 2 5 4 3 6, heights: 6 15. Output: 1 2 3 & 4 5 6
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Chess Knight Configuration Validation
description: Given a 5X5 chess board as input, 9 knights are placed. Print whether the configuration is valid or invalid.
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Decode Number to Letters
description: Given a number, print all the codes that can be formed. {a=1, ..., z=26}. Input: 1123, Output: aabc, kbc, aaw, kw
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Palindrome with Special Characters
description: Given a String with or without special characters, find if it is Palindrome. No splitting of array or additional space for storing. Example: 'RACE CAR', 'I DID, DID I ?'
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Array Modification with Doubling
description: Given an array, if next valid number is same as current, double its value and replace next with 0. Then shift all 0s to end. Input: {2, 2, 0, 4, 0, 8}, Output: 4 4 8 0 0 0
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Twisted Prime Number
description: A number is twisted prime if it is prime and its reverse is also prime. Input: 97, Output: Twisted Prime Number
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Pair with Given Sum
description: Given an array A[] and a number x, check for pair in A[] with sum as x. Input: {1, 2, 4, 3, 5, 6}, SUM: 5. Output: 2 pairs (1,4) & (2,3)
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Largest Sum Contiguous Subarray (Kadane's Algorithm)
description: Find the contiguous subarray with the largest sum using Kadane's algorithm.

title: Diamond Pattern
description: Print diamond pattern for given input size. Example: size 3 prints star diamond
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Wildcard Pattern Matching
description: Given a text and wildcard pattern, implement pattern matching. '?' matches any single character, '*' matches any sequence. Example: Text='baaabab', Pattern='*****ba*****ab', Output: true
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Word Break Problem
description: Given an input string and dictionary of words, find if input can be segmented into space-separated dictionary words. Input: 'ilike', Dictionary: {i, like, sam, sung, samsung}, Output: Yes
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Pattern Printing Triangle
hints: Optimize for time and space complexity

title: Array Modification with Doubling and Zero Shift
description: Given an array, if number is repeated add and put next to 0. If 0 print at last. Input: {0, 2, 2, 2, 0, 6, 6, 0, 8}, Output: 4 2 12 8 0 0 0 0 0

title: Remove Characters Present in Second String
description: Given two strings s1 and s2, remove all characters from s1 which are present in s2. Input: s1='expErIence', s2='En', Output: s1='exprIece'

title: Next Greater Element for Each Element

title: Rectangle Sum in Matrix
description: Given 2D matrix and indices, print rectangle and find sum of elements. Input: matrix and (2,0) to (3,4), Output: Rectangle and sum 54

title: Operations Using Only Addition Operator

title: Find Anagram in Array

title: Number with Equal Sum on Both Sides
description: Array of numbers given, find a number which has same sum on either side. Input: 1 2 3 7 6, Output: 7 (has 1+2+3=6 on left, 6 on right)
